I can create a banana out of nothing, and maybe it lasts thirty minutes. But if I teleport a banana, it remains forever.
Well... If that's true, that's great news. We can easily teleport him back!
I’m afraid not Moxie, sending him back may be impossible.
Impossible?!
That doesn’t make any sense! If I could bring him here with magic, that means we can use magic to send him back when we're done.
Penelope slowly shakes her head, placing her hand on Moxie’s shoulder, she speaks directly to her.
I know you have a great passion for magic Moxie, but there's still a lot you may not understand...
The problem with teleportation is that it comes with some serious adverse side effects.
Huh? Side effects?
I think Moxie and I need to have a quick private conversation.
[playername], could you take a seat at the sitting area while you wait? I'll bring us some tea when we're done and fill you in.
I sat on a chair at a quaint sitting area by the library’s reception. Moxie and Penelope were talking in private while I waited.
Moxie returned first with our tea, it was purple, and the flavour was outlandish yet curiously enjoyable.
Moxie was shortly followed by Penelope sitting opposite to us across the table.
I hope the tea is to your liking, [playername]. I’m afraid what I’m about to say may not be.
Now this isn’t my area of expertise, just a few ideas I’ve learnt from working closely with Lily, so this may not be completely accurate.
I want to ask who Lily is, I’ve heard that name thrown around a few times, but I dare not interrupt.
The act of teleportation typically involves the recreation of your atomic composition.
If your memories of a previous world are true, that means there is, or was, an original version of you.
This individual must have either been copied and pasted, or morbidly, cut and pasted.
Why though? Why can’t it be the same me?
It’s impossible to transport a living being faster than the speed of light, true teleportation is to re-create your body atom by atom.
So even if we did send him back, we’d either still have him here, or we’d essentially be killing the original, only to replace him with a teleported copy…
The original me may already be dead, I can only hope I was copied instead of cut like Penelope explained.
That's like a philosophical zombie.
If this is all true, that means I'm just a replica of my original self.
And even if you were to send me back, you'd just create another replica.
Exactly, wow, you're even quicker than Moxie.
Pfft, don't gang up on me, I'm totally keeping up.
If this is all true, I don’t even know if I want to try going back. This mind, me, my consciousness, would cease to exist, only to be replaced by a replica that shares all my memories.
If I were you, I'd forget your past life, and get used to living here.
There's a high probability that the original version of you is doing just fine, so don't worry.
That's good news, I think!
I know it's a lot to take in, so I'll lend you the utmost support.
Thank you, there's no point in being negative. It's just like moving to a new city, right?
Ohh yeah, I did that recently too, we're in the same boat!
Let's live the best lives we can then Mox.
Moxie and I high-five.
Awhahah, this is sweet to see.
I reckon you and me have a lot to discuss regarding living arrangements then.
You certainly do, feel free to come here for advice, either of you.
You're still... Are you really so against living here?
Come on [playername], I'll do my best...
You're making Moxie cry.
I-I'm not!
I'm afraid that might not be possible.
Even if we knew where you're from, the original you may still be alive.
That would be complicated...
What do you think, then?
You're really adamant about going back...
I guarantee you this won't work out the way you're hoping.
Even if we do send you back, you'll literally still be here!
Remember, the philosophical zombie thing you mentioned?
Shit, you're right... It's impossible for this body and brain of mine to go back.
Please reconsider.
Perfect!
Is it time? Should I...?
Yep. Now, since you're a new creature to this world, we need to cast a few essential spells in order to acclimatize your body to the new surroundings.
Eh? What do you mean?
What Penelope is saying is, you're full of alien bacteria, so you could infect us with something deadly!
And vice versa, it'd be such a shame for you to die of an illness.
Moxie, can you do the honours?
No problem, don't move an inch, [playername]!
Moxie cast two spells on me, her horn encapsulating me in a magical glow each time.
My balls tingle slightly, as the light dissipates. I've never had magic cast on me before, it's weird.
Perfect, I guess he's all set to be let loose on the world?
Hehe, it worked! This is gonna be so much fun!
There's one more thing though, could I at least check to see if the original me is alive?
I’m afraid we have no way to know where you’re from. Teleportation magic requires the caster to think of mental ‘coordinates’. It’s hard to explain.
I think what Penny is saying is that when I cast the spell before, I misfired, meaning I accidentally used a completely random coordinate that just happened to be on you [playername].
Random? There’s no way I could accept that. You could misfire that spell ad infinitum and never get the same result.
There’s more to this, it’s just a hunch, but there are no coincidences of this magnitude in magic.
This is kinda exciting if you think about it positively, the three of us solving a mystery. The rookie from a galaxy far away, the passionate performer and the genius librarian!
Hold up, I thought we already solved the mystery.
Yeah, but [playername] is my magnum opus, so if I write a paper on him, I need to be as accurate as possible!
I'm a scientific study now?
You're a magical study! Once they find out about you, I'll get into college for sure.
Eh... I’m a little too busy to get involved with these shenanigans right now. I’m working here almost every day while trying to finish my own papers, specifically in this season too, pain in the ass.
Moxie’s enthusiasm deflates, she hunches over as she sinks into the chair.
Oh Mox, I’ll help you a little, I guess, just don’t expect too much.
You know what? Moxie, you've already done something stupendous, even I'm still trying to rationalise what happened in my head.
Moxie, if you can figure this out and present it to the college, there will be no doubt about how amazing and talented you are, you’ll get in for sure.
Ah Penny, you’re being too kind again, you know this kind of thing is way over my head… But I’ll do my best.
Don’t worry, I’ll try to give you a bit of a head start, I’m pretty curious about how this situation might unfold myself.

There are two things I think you'll need to investigate first, the book of course, and the area surrounding where [playername] first appeared, and I want you to figure out their significance if you can.
Oh, and next time you visit, bring the book and anything you find, we'll talk through it together
Seemingly giddy, Moxie jumps up and nods.
You’ve got it! Anything out of the ordinary and the book. I’ll see you soon Penny.
Moxie turns to me and gestures for us to head out, practically skipping as she does so.
Go get her, tiger.
I wink to Penelope, I will.
I assume we're going back to the wagon, I’m not sure, I'm just following Moxie.
That was unusual, yet refreshing.
What do you think, should I just live the best life I can here?
Yes! I'll do everything I can to accommodate you.
The people around here are so friendly and accommodating too, I discovered that myself when I moved here.
Yeah, Penelope was really nice.
Penny liked you, y’know! She isn’t usually that friendly and talkative with strangers!
She isn’t usually friendly? You could have fooled me, she seems lovely.
That’s just how Penny is, she’s a real softy on the inside, but she has a mature serious side too.
A softy on the inside, a bit like you then?
Shush you, lots of girls have a soft side, that’s one of the best parts about them.
Speaking of mature and serious though, Penny scolded me, she made some good points while she and I were talking alone.
Thing is, you don’t have a clue about our world, our species, our culture, nothing! It’s not something you can just ignore by hiding in my wagon.
I’d be open to learn more about those things though, it sounds exciting.
Moxie pokes my cheek and runs ahead a few steps before turning back towards me, I stop and look to her earnestly.
I wonder if there’s anything serious I need to learn about this world, maybe surprising laws or cultural differences.
You’re going to be staying with me in my wagon, that’s the deal we made last night.
Is the deal still on?
Ehehe, unless you wanna live on the street, I think so.
True...
Buuut, I was being a little idealistic at the time.
You can’t just stay at my wagon all day doing nothing, you need to get out there, get a job, meet people, et cetera!
I’m gonna release you to the world so you can earn some monies.
Then at night when you come back, I’ll feed you, my treat! I’ve been looking for an excuse to start cooking properly anyway.
Oh, also! I’ll try to teach you a bit about our culture and society.
If I'm staying, it makes sense that I learn about this world. Where am I going to work though?
Don’t sweat it, we all help each other out in the Arcadian suburbs, it’s a small community. Penny gave me a few suggestions, bless her.
There’s a farm to the north that specialises in the harvest of apples and various crops, the current owner Honeycrisp seems to have some kind of injury right now and is looking for help.
Next to my wagon just slightly to the east you may have noticed a large round building.
That's Ruby’s boutique, she works here making a designer fashion line. I design my own clothes too, so I think it’d be fun to work there, but maybe too difficult for me.
Also, Cream has this delicious cake shop near the market, all homemade and very delicious. Just be careful, she's a little unpredictable!

Can’t forget Riku, she’s running a quaint bar out of the ground floor of her own house, she’s doing really well for herself and should hopefully take you in on a small wage. Sometimes in the evening me and some of the girls meet up there for a drink.

Well, there’s one girl that seldom drinks, and that would be Butters. She’s some kind of alchemist or something. Ridiculously shy though, there’s probably not much point in going to work with her, but maybe you’re into shy girls.
That’s quite the selection, I’ve actually never worked any jobs like those. Suppose I should try a few out and see what fits me best.
It’s a pretty flexible situation, you could probably work at the library too if you wanted.
What about you, can’t we work together?
Haha, I wish! Maybe if you could grow a horn and learn magic in a day. I’m a street performer that wows people with basic magic, it’s a temporary thing.
That’s a surprise, I didn’t think you’d be someone that’d enjoy that.
Ahh… Well, it's a part of what I enjoy. What I really want to do is explore magic and perhaps one day become a researcher, Penelope is helping by lending me books.
I'll need to go to a college, ideally to the Royal Arcadian College, but I’m not talented enough to pass the tests yet.
She lets out a dreamy sigh and looks up into the city. The city has a lot of verticality to it. From the ground level of the suburbs the fantasy castles looks dizzyingly tall.
The University is in the city? I didn’t get a good look on the way to the library, but the castles are stunningly beautiful.
It sounds like hard work, but I’m sure if you do the reading and study, you’ll be able to make it.
Yeah… I'm glad you said that actually, a lot of people can underestimate how much hard work is required, and hard work is what dreams are made of.
The dizzyingly high castles certainly make a difference to the modest wooden structures of the ground level.
The suburbs are small in comparison, this area seems to mostly consist of small homes, inns and a few shops dotted around like the boutique, bakery and bar.
It’s cute, like a small community where everyone would know each other. The strange hairless man is probably already the talk of the town.
When we first walked to the library, I was so tense, but now I’m looking forward to spending my time here and learning more about the world.
Oh yeah? How ‘bout we go get some ice cream and I can teach you more? My treat!
Ice cream? Sounds like a delicious idea, weren’t we going to work though?
Ahh don’t be silly, I can’t just send you over to the girls’ businesses randomly. First Penny is sending out some magic mail explaining the situation. We’ll probably have a reply by tomorrow.
In that case, string me along, I love ice cream.
Moxie orders us both a whipped ice-cream from a small café that’s only an eye-view away from her wagon.
There are a couple of tables with seats outside, but Moxie leads me to a secluded seating area that’s a little further from the others.
The ice cream is delicious; it tastes slightly different to anything from back home.
The peculiarity of the taste causes me to take my time and savour each lick. It is delightful. A part of me was worried I’d have to eat hay-burgers.
But fortunately, it'd seem the diets of these anthropomorphic ponies are no different than my own.
Any questions? I’m sure you have a lot, right?
Huh? Okay... That's a boring question, although it's pretty important I guess.
I’ll break it down in the most fun way I can.
Sure.
We’re in Arcadia right now, it’s both capital and country, Aurora bless Arcadia and all that.
Ah, speaking of Aurora. There’s one ruling group called the Royal Sisters, it’s a monarchy, although egalitarianism is an important aspect of their government.
They’re complicated. Queen Aurora has ruled for millennia and her younger sister Selene is only marginally younger.
Did I hear that right? Did she just say millennia?!
I adore Selene, she's this super powerful space-time alicorn and I've really gotten into some of her books.
That'd be a unicorn with wings. But there's a bit more to it than that.
Crazy buggers, they seem to live for way longer than us normal folk.
Allegedly in old religious texts they raise the sun and the moon, but I don’t think anyone actually believes that in the modern era.
Why did they ever believe it if it isn't true?
That's a good question. Not one I could answer though, you'd have to ask the long dead scholars of old scriptures.
How do the two sisters rule?
They’re benevolent rulers, they’re extraordinary actually and often a role model for society.
It's like they're perfect, almost too perfect, like angels- or better, two guardian goddesses to keep us in check.
Wow... Guess I'll have to see it to believe it.
Anything else?
I'm not entirely sure what it classifies as, they're both monarchy and government. However they take opinions of the public sector deeply into consideration.
With these Royal Sisters having no opposition it sounds like autocratic authority.
Yeah sure, but these two still carry out the will of the people, they're not dictators.
Even without any political parties?
It seems we haven't a need for any political pluralism. These sisters do such a damn good job no one has bothered to rally an opposing party.

I think it'd be interesting to have more opposition, since politics here is a stagnant pond, but everything has been running so smoothly for the past few centuries that people are content with what we've got.
So... this is a society that has managed to find a 'perfect' government?
Nothing's perfect, however it's pretty close, and I can't remember the last time I saw someone complain.
The two sisters are practically idolised, they seem to run a damn good country...
Of course, you're in ponytown right now. Biggest influx of ponies here.
That's a good question. I don't know what your world is like, but with any luck it's similar to this one.
No stealing, no killing, no horrible acts that cause harm or misfortune.
I wasn't planning on killing everyone, I was mostly concerned about smaller things I might miss like jaywalking.
Like, if I was working, do I have to pay tax? Am I going to be jailed for tax evasion?
Don't worry about that, I'll sort out the boring stuff. You can keep the money, that's just between me and you.
We don't live in a strict society, as long as you're a good person you don't need to worry about getting in trouble with the law.
If you do get jailed though, I can't bail you out.
I'll keep that in mind.
I haven't been here long but the community is great.
I'm definitely on the bottom rungs though, it gets better from here.
Crime and disorder are barely existent and there’s tons of opportunity for everyone to flourish in the system, even someone like me.
Heck, even you, newbie! You can get a job and make a living as long as you pull your weight.
That sounds fantastic, almost too good to be true. Although, given all the smiling faces, I can believe it.
Yeah, everyone is encouraged to contribute to society, as a result communities form that all help each other. Like the suburbs here.
For example, Honeycrisp farms apples and processes them, sells the resulting booze to Riku at her bar, then we all go drink it.
A good community is filled with these happy little cycles where the end result is a bunch of ponies with bellies full of food, drink and happiness.
Reminds me of how a village would run back in the olden days, everyone in the village would contribute so the village could run independently.
After Moxie and I run through the basics of this new world, I feel more confident in my being here.
But this place seems too good to be true... Why is everything running so smoothly in this world?
Is it really as simple as magic spells and guardian goddesses that look after everyone? Hmm, Earth probably would be a better place if we had that.
This is hard, I feel like I've barely told you anything.
Don't worry, this has been very insightful, thank you.
I guess the best way for you to learn about our world is simply experiencing it.
A couple of female ponies walk past and take a peek at me.
I take a peek too, I’m still not quite used to seeing naked women, let alone ponies walk around in broad daylight.
The stares feel different from this morning.
Now that I’m more comfortable in my own skin, I know that they’re not judging or shocked, they’re genuinely curious.
The right most one isn't remotely interested though, she must be the tsundere of the bunch. As expected from a redhead with twin tails.
Wow, the one with the blue eyes just winked at me.
Are they flirting with me?
Moxie giggles, she caught me staring.
I think they like you.
I'm sure they were just staring because I look weird.
You’re unusual, I know, but there’s more reasons than novelty for why girls would look at you.
What do you mean by that?
You don’t know? Come on, I bet you can figure it out.
Are they not staring at me because I’m the first human they’ve ever seen?
Sure, sure, there’s a little bit of that, but there are plenty of species in this world. I’m sure a dragon, griffon, or neko would get a few curious looks too.
Dragons, griffons, and neko huh? I guess it only makes sense that this world has other species, but it’s still surprising to hear it.
I finish my ice cream while I try to guess what Moxie is implying, but even as I bite into the cone nothing comes to mind.
I don’t get what you’re saying.
Heh, I can’t believe you haven’t figured it out, even after hanging around me.
They’re staring at you because you’re male, it’s pony mating season and men are in hot demand right now.
I could feel a rush of blood towards my nethers as she said that, but I’m nude and in public, so I resist getting ahead of myself.
That’s crazy, you’re telling me that these humanoid pony girls go into heat?
Moxie looks around innocently and nods, in hindsight everything from last night along with her deal makes a lot more sense now.
Haven’t you noticed? I thought males are supposed to notice and get aroused when around females in heat.
I'm supposed to get aroused? Now that you mention it, I did feel something last night. Even though I was tired and had masturbated only a few hours earlier, I was really horny.
Yeah, you really wanted that blowjob, jerk.
And I've had girlfriends before, being alone with a girl isn't new to me. Yet I could feel something new and powerful.
It just felt right.
Yeah… I can relate. I felt something from you too, your species and mine are perhaps not so different…
One of the reasons I picked a table that was hidden away from the others is because I wanted this conversation to be private, there’s something I need to say.
You can take this as a warning, or an opportunity...
You’re going to be quite popular with the mares, girls may come to you and try to talk to you, perhaps asking you to come to their place for ‘coffee’.
It's popular among mares to have sex with other species because there’s no risk of pregnancy. You’ll be coveted simply because you’re a male of a different species.
What a great role reversal, the girls will be coming to me instead of the other way round.
They sure will, men are super popular on dating websites.
It'll take me a long time to get used to that.
Heh, are the women in your world different or something?
I’m afraid you’ll be fetishized, perhaps even objectified to a degree. If anyone doesn’t treat you right, you’re well within your means to leave the situation.
You shouldn't be scared though. Don't you humans have heat?
Heat simply isn’t a thing in my species.
Your human women don’t experience heat at all? I didn't realize that!
I’ll try to explain it then, might save you some trouble.
You said you felt unusually aroused last night, right? That'll be due to pheromones.
Due to these pheromones, if you’re alone with a mare in heat for a long enough time, the impulse for sex will grow. It’s biologically wired that way.
Biologically wired? Why? That seems a bit intense.
Intense perhaps, but heat is heat, it's evolved to be like that.
Arousal signals keep pinging back and forth between the male and female like a feedback loop.
It’ll keep going until you’re both unbearably aroused. And trust me, these girls are already unbearably aroused, because there’s not a whole lot to go around…
I can't entirely tell if Moxie's explaining the science or her opinion, but there's something that doesn't quite sit right with me about this whole situation.
I finally realized I've been overlooking something quite simple ever since I arrived.
I haven’t seen a single other male creature, which is a particularly important crux of this conversation.
Moxie, I need to ask. I haven’t seen a single male, where are they?
Hm? I’m assuming they’re in the same place as your world, scattered about here and there, they’re just a lot rarer than the females.
Rarer? No, actually there’s a 50/50 split where I’m from, so that is quite shocking to discover.
Ahh, damnit, I keep making assumptions about you and humans... You really are different.
Alright, so, males here are relatively a lot rarer. Maybe a 15/85 split, and that split varies between species apparently, I don’t know.
The point is, there’re not enough stallions to go around.
That’s so weird… Why are the males so rare? That seems paradoxical from an evolutionary perspective.
Right? I was curious myself, so Penny lent me some books on the subject, and I’ve done some reading.
According to one biology book, we were evolved from an alpha male system where a single male would copulate with a herd of females.
I have to assume that through natural selection females that birthed more female young were the preference.
It sounds like our species have slightly different biology then, that’d be impossible for humans.
Anyway, alpha male? Sounds kind of scary, does this suburb have an alpha male that impregnates all the mares?
Haha, no, absolutely not. That herd mentality died many millenia ago. We've since developed society and culture. Monogamy is seen as desirable in the modern age.
A lot of mares actually have the dream of falling in love with their one and only. I must admit, I can see why the idea of being singled out among so many mares is appealing.

Although the reality is that stallions are in such hot demand, they’re often the ones being swept off their feet by rich and attractive mares, because being married is seen as an extravagant status symbol.
I assure you all the richest mares have husbands.
So… What do all the lonely mares do? Seems pretty awful.
Nah, not as awful as you might think.
Many have life-long relationships with other mares… I think Penny will do that when she’s older.
Ah, a fair few lesbian relationships, then?
Lesbian? I haven't heard that word in a long time, we don't tend to use words like that to describe people.
Most mares like both sexes, including myself. As such they're not really considered 'lesbian' relationships, they're considered normal.
You also have to consider interspecies relationships, of which there is no stigma.
Pardon my ignorance, but how aren’t you going extinct? If monogamy is the standard, then even if every couple is having 2 to 3 children the overall population is at a loss.
Ah-hah! So, you are paying attention. A lack of breeding is no small problem, but the issue has been alleviated by the magic of unicorns. Unicorns are the founders and upholders of pony society.

Unicorns have ways to artificially inseminate mares, multiple ways! Every mare has the opportunity to have a child. Not everyone does, but it gives our population of 25,000 a healthy steadiness. No overpopulation or underpopulation.
25,000... Wow, is that really all?
It’s not unusual to see a single mare with a child, like my mother, or a mare couple with a child.
That’s amazing, I wish the problems of my world could be solved with a swish and flick of a wand, or horn.
I know! I love magic, I'd love to show you a thing or two so you can see how wonderful it is.
I’ve always daydreamed about being able to do magic. I guess I won’t be the one doing it, but this is like having my fantasy become a reality.
Then what are we waiting for? My wagon is only across the river, let’s go!
Moxie grabs my hand and we both jog to her nearby wagon.
Moxie reaches for a shelf, and since she’s a little on the short side, she has to get on her tippy toes to reach.
She huffs adorably as she lifts down a spell tome. I figured she'd have a magic spell to make that easier, but what do I know?
Okay, this one has lots of fun things! This is a magic fun book; it has a couple of simple spells in here for entertainment.

Each spell in the tome has a double paged spread, a picture, some instructions, and some tips for utilisation and casting. It’s like a recipe book for magic. Unlike a recipe book though, there are no ingredients.
Come to think of it, the book does seem rather juvenile, as if it's aimed at younger audiences.
Hey Mox, I have a question: can any unicorn just cast a spell without preparation or ingredients? Isn’t there a law of equivalent exchange?
I’m not the best person to ask, you should’ve asked Penny while you had the chance.
I’ve only read a little bit on the theory, but any Unicorn can cast a spell if they learn how to do it. However, they have a limited pool of magical power that they draw from.
No external ingredients are required, but you only have so much magical power, once that's gone you feel exhausted and sleepy.
You can regenerate magical power by sleeping or eating, so in some ways, there may ultimately be some kind of equivalent exchange as you say. Heh, talking about this makes me feel like a nerd.
Oh, and ponies have varying magic 'pool' sizes; it’s like a muscle, it can get bigger!
I snap my fingers triumphantly as I have my own little realisation, it’s just like mana from a video game.
I wonder if they have video games in this world. There are so many random interesting things that may or may not be here that are subtly different to my world.
I know Moxie has a radio, and I think she has a laptop too.
Didn't she mention dating websites earlier? Either way, I'm getting sidetracked.
Okay, how’s your mana, can you show me a few spells?
Mana? You mean my magic? Well, I certainly can, there are plenty of small spells we can mess around with. Here’s one I can do off by heart, this is a classic!
I watch eagerly and lean in as I see the purple aura around her horn stir, it maintains its glow for a while, but nothing appears to happen.
I sit there with growing confusion as Moxie returns a smug look.
In the corner of my eye I see movement...
Upon turning to see, a floating stuffed bunny rabbit from the shelf falls right onto my lap!
Wow! Telekinesis, right? That’s awesome, I’ve always wanted to do that.
Ahah, I know, pretty awesome right? That one has a pretty severe weight and distance limit. To be honest, I wouldn’t even be able to lift up this spell book at my current level.
That explains the lightweight bunny rabbit as her choice of object.
Still, you gotta love being able to write things down using telekinesis, it’s a dream when you’re doing a task that requires three hands. Or if you’re lazy and don’t want to reach for something!
You’ll make me jealous, and we’re only on the first spell! What else is there?
This book is full of silly things: like changing the pitch of your voice, changing the colour of your hair, or giving yourself cat ears.
They’re all temporary though, the laws around magic can be strict.
That makes sense, you wouldn’t want a unicorn changing their identity and framing someone else for a crime.
Uhh, heh, something like that!
Anyway... If you recall I’m a street magic performer so I know all sorts of dumb tricks, although I won’t be shooting off any fireworks inside my wagon.
Easy peasy, watch this.
Woah, it's like you instantly dyed your hair!
Don'cha think blondes have more fun?
I brush my fingers through Moxie's hair, it's incredible.
Awh man, these spells really don't last very long.
Why does a spell as simple as changing hair colour last such a short time?
People dye their hair all the time where I'm from.
Magic is kinda complicated. My hair may have looked dyed, but perhaps it was just a temporary optical illusion.
Perhaps my hair was indeed dyed; coated with a blonde colour, or the molecular composition of my hair changed.
It's hard to say, but there are better ways to dye your hair than a spell.
Right, I think I understand.
Oh? You want me to do that? If only...
It's a really tough one, most ponies can't even do this.
I have to visualise someone in my mind as accurately as I can. Although, I suppose it doesn't matter if I botch it slightly.
I could try Penelope, I know her inside and out, hehe. Okay, here goes nothing.
Hoi dere I'm Penelope, how do I look?
Woah, that's almost perfect!
